vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
δῐ-θάλασσος,
Attic dialect διθάλαττος [θᾰ], ον, divided into two seas, of the Euxine, [Refs 1st c.BC+]; of the Atlantic, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II between two seas, where two seas meet, as is often the case off a headland, [NT]; βραχέα καὶ διθάλαττα shallows and meetings of currents, in the Syrtes, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: sandbar, sandbank (surrounded on both sides by sea)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
sandbar, sandbank (surrounded on both sides by sea)
surrounded on both sides by the sea;, τόπος διθάλασσος, a shoal or sand-bank formed by the confluence of opposite currents, Acts 27:41*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: entre los mares ; bajío, banco de arena, arrecife o corrientes cruzadas (HCH.27:41)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: bãi cát ngầm / lưỡi đất giữa hai biển; Eo đất
